# Database Quick Start

Varity includes a zero-config database powered by Supabase. Import and start querying immediately.

## Installation

The database module is included in `@varity-labs/sdk`. No additional packages needed.

## Quick Start

```typescript
import { db } from '@varity-labs/sdk';

// Create a collection
const users = db.collection('users');

// Insert a document
await users.insert({
  name: 'John Doe',
  email: 'john@example.com',
  plan: 'starter'
});

// Query documents
const activeUsers = await users.find({ plan: 'starter' });

// Update a document
await users.update({ email: 'john@example.com' }, { plan: 'growth' });

// Delete a document
await users.delete({ email: 'john@example.com' });
```

## Environment Variables

Set these in your `.env.local` file:

```bash
NEXT_PUBLIC_VARITY_APP_ID=your-app-id
NEXT_PUBLIC_VARITY_APP_TOKEN=your-app-token
NEXT_PUBLIC_VARITY_DB_PROXY_URL=your-db-url
```

<Aside type="tip">
When you deploy with `varietykit app deploy`, database credentials are automatically injected. No manual setup needed!
</Aside>
